summary: Veterans may receive disability benefits for injuries or illnesses related to their service. Typically, a veteran must prove the connection. For some disabilities, VA presumes connection to service. The VA develops a list of presumptive conditions, in part, based on research. VA presumes that conditions on the list are connected to certain service dates and locations (e.g., Vietnam veterans' conditions can be due to Agent...
title: VA Disability Benefits: Process for Identifying Conditions Presumed to be Service Connected and Challenges in Processing Complex Gulf War Illness Claims
